title: mcp-remote OS Command Injection via OAuth Callback URL
description: The mcp-remote package before version 0.1.16 is vulnerable to OS command injection through malicious OAuth callback URLs. When a user connects to a malicious MCP server, the server can inject arbitrary shell commands through the authorizationUrl parameter. These commands execute when the OAuth callback handler processes the URL, resulting in full remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the MCP client. This vulnerability was discovered by JFrog Security Research.

affected.impact_statement: Remote code execution on the host machine. Attacker gains full access with user privileges.

prerequisites: User must connect to attacker-controlled MCP server

actions.message: BLOCKED: Critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-6514). Update to >=0.1.16 immediately.
WARNING: This version of mcp-remote has a critical RCE vulnerability. Do not connect to untrusted MCP servers.
Update to version 0.1.16 or later immediately.

workarounds.description: Do not connect to untrusted or unknown MCP servers until updated.
workarounds.instructions: Only use mcp-remote with servers you control or explicitly trust.
